intro: Lactuca pilosa, commonly known as the hairy lettuce, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its upright stems and fuzzy, lobed leaves that are covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, green flowers arranged in a loose cluster, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It is often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Lactuca pilosa is part of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its milky sap that can be mildly toxic.
